item.title: Corner of Hoveden Road and Walm Lane, next to the EV Chargers, 15th November
item.description:
Massive pile of rubbish, mattresses and broken furniture left on the street WHICH DOESN'T ALLOW PEDESTRIAN, BUGGIES, AND WHEELCHAIRS TO USE THE PAVEMENT. We pay a lot for the Council Tax each month. This is not the service we expected to receive. You of course must already be aware of the fly-tipping that has gone on for the last 3 years in front of 67 Keyes Road. How can this go on for this long? It's all great to receive marketing emails promising to target the issue, but we'd like those words to be put into practice. We're walking in the middle of rubbish here, left by people who clearly think they can go unpunished, as most of the rubbish is literally blocking the passage. Think, how do kids, buggies, blind and older people feel when they see this?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Walm Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Dumped rubbish again, 15th November
item.description:
It's starting all over again, the green between 176-206 Kingsground SE9 5EW. As you can see from the pictures rubbish has started to accumulate on the green yet again, it has become a hot spot for people to get rid of their rubbish. There are a lot of cardboard boxes which could have easily been folded and put in their blue bins, they seem too lazy to do so. I have again contacted our local councillor about the problem. Please there must be some way of preventing this happening time and time again. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsground, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unacceptable leaf mound, 15th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Ling Road, Northumberland Heath, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping Balfour Street/ Victory Place, 15th November
item.description:
Often there are personal rubbish bin bags left around the bin on the corner of Balfour Street and Victory Place. Overnight foxes often rip them apart putting rubbish everywhere. In the photo the foxes haven't gotten to them yet.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balfour Road, Walworth, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Selling of vehicles., 15th November
item.description:
A person on a weekly basis is using the small area of parking between Normandy Way and Swallow Close to sell cars. Once a car is sold another appears in a few days. This is quite dangerous if you are coming up or down the hill especially if there is another car parked opposite. This space hasnâ€™t been an issue until recently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colyers Lane, North End, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
